Question
========
A researcher wants to compare two independent groups (full-time students and part-time students) on the distribution of their scores on a practicum. He considers the scores to be measured at the ordinal measurement level. The null hypothesis is that the two distributions are the same.

 Group 1: 2, 3, 4, 4, 6 Group 2: 5, 6, 7, 8, 9

If two-sided testing is done at 5% then:

  
Answerlist
----------
* H0 must be rejected because Uobt < Ucrit
* H0 must be rejected because Uobt > Ucrit
* H0 should not be rejected because Uobt < Ucrit
* H0 should not be rejected because Uobt > Ucrit

Solution
========


Answerlist
----------
* This answer is correct.
* This answer is incorrect.
* This answer is incorrect.
* This answer is incorrect.
